html:
GRANT AGREEMENT

 

 

 

 

BETWEEN

 

 

 

{{proposal.donor_name}}

 (THE DONOR)

 

 

 

 

 

AND

 

 

 

 

{{ngo_details.ngo_name}}

(THE RECIPIENT)

 

 

 

 

 

 

GRANT AGREEMENT

 

This grant agreement ("Agreement") is made on this {{other_details.modified_date}} at Bangalore, Karnataka and is effective as of {{other_details.start_date}}, ("Effective Date")

 

BETWEEN

 

  1.            Donor Name a philanthropy incorporated under the laws of India, having its registered office at 10th Floor, Dr. Raj Kumar Road, Malleshwaram (W) Bangalore, Karnataka 560055 (hereinafter referred to as "Donor", which expression shall, unless repugnant to the context or meaning thereof, be deemed to include its nominee(s) and permitted assign(s)), of the FIRST PART;

 

 

AND

 

{{ngo_details.ngo_name}}, registered as {{ngo_details.registration_of_the_organisaiton}} having its registered office at {{ngo_details.address_1}} {{ngo_details.address_2}} {{ngo_details.address_3}} {{ngo_details.district_name}} {{ngo_details.state_name}} {{ngo_details.pincode}}  (hereinafter referred as “Recipient” which expression shall be deemed to include its successors, administrators, heirs, assigns and nominees), of the SECOND PART.

 

The Donor and the Recipient are herein referred to individually as a "Party" and collectively referred to as the "Parties".

 

WHEREAS

 

  1.            The Donor is in the business of providing support services and conducting testing related activities (hereinafter known as "Business").

 

  1.            The Donor, has agreed to finance the below mentioned Project(s) (defined below) of the Recipient, which has the necessary infrastructure, expertise and experience required for carrying out, conducting and providing facilities for {project details}by way of a Grant (defined below) of INR {{proposal.total_planned_budget}}/- {{other_details.amount_in_words}}).

 

  1.            The Parties have entered into this Agreement to record their mutual understanding and set out the terms and conditions in relation to the Grant and other matters in connection thereto which they agree will be interpreted, acted upon and governed in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.

 

NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and the mutual covenants set forth herein, the sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

 

  1.               DEFINITION AND INTERPRETATION

 

  1.         Definitions

 

"Affiliate" of the Recipient, means any Person that, directly or indirectly, Controls, is Controlled by or is under common Control with the Recipient, whereas "Affiliate" of the Donor means any entity in which the Donor or its group companies have directly or indirectly, certain economic interest. For avoidance of doubt, any reference to an Affiliate of the Donor under this Agreement shall mean "an Affiliate domiciled in India";

 

"Agents" means, in relation to a Person, that Person's directors, officers, employees, advisers, agents and representatives;

 

"Agreement" means this Agreement along with its recitals and schedules, as amended, supplemented or replaced or otherwise modified from time to time, and any other document which, (a) amends, supplements, replaces or otherwise modifies this Agreement or (b) by reference is made a part of this Agreement;

 

"Applicable Law" means, with respect to any Person, all provisions of laws, statutes, ordinances, codes, standards, rules, regulations, permits or certificates of any Governmental Authority, as may be updated from time to time, applicable to such Person or any of its assets or property, and all judgments, injunctions, orders and decrees of any Governmental Authorities in proceedings or actions in which such Person is a party or by which any of its assets or properties are bound or the rules or regulations of any applicable governmental, quasi-governmental or self-regulating authority binding upon such Party for the time being (whether or not having force in law);

 

"Business"has the meaning ascribed to it under recital (A) of the Agreement;

 

"Business Day" means a day (other than a Saturday or Sunday or a public holiday) when commercial banks are open for ordinary banking business in Bangalore, India;

 

"Confidential Information" means all non-public information disclosed orally, visually, electronically, in writing or in any tangible form of information by the Donor, its Affiliates, or their respective Agents or contractors (each, a "Disclosing Party") to the Recipient, its Affiliates or any Agents of any of them (each, a "Receiving Party") that is designated as confidential or that, given the nature of the information or the circumstances surrounding its disclosure, reasonably should be considered as confidential. Confidential Information includes (i) non-public information relating to the Disclosing Party's Business, trade secrets, technology (including software, databases, data processing or communications networking systems), customers, suppliers, Business plans, strategies, forecasts or forecast assumptions, operations, methods of doing Business, records, assets, promotional and marketing activities, finances and other business affairs, (ii) third-party information that the Disclosing Party is obligated to keep confidential, and (iii) the nature, content and existence of any discussions or negotiations between the Parties, including the terms of this Agreement. For the avoidance of doubt, all customer information and any information disclosed by the Donor while making the Grant shall be treated as Confidential Information;

 

"Control" means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause the direction of the management or policies of any Person, whether through the ownership of over 50% (Fifty percent) of voting securities, through the power to appoint over half of the members of the board of directors or similar governing body of such Person or by contract or otherwise and "Controls" and "Controlled" shall be understood accordingly;

 

"Continuing Provisions" means Clause 1 (Definitions and Interpretation), Clause 5 (Representations and Warranties and Indemnity), Clause 7 (Confidentiality), Clause 11(Governing Law and Dispute Resolution), Clause 12 (Notices), and Clause 13 (Miscellaneous) of the Agreement.

 

"Dispute"has the meaning ascribed to it under Clause 11.1 of the Agreement;

 

"Financial Statements" with respect to a period, shall mean the balance sheet, profit and loss account, statements of income and cash flows and statement of changes in shareholders' equity, prepared on a consolidated basis or otherwise, as may be required under the Applicable Law;

 

"Grant" means a donation made by the Donor for a charitable purpose and/or to benefit a cause by offering; 

"Governmental Authority" means any instrumentality, subdivision, court, administrative agency, commission, official or other authority of the Republic of India or any other country or any state, province, municipality, locality or other government or political subdivision thereof, or any quasi-governmental or private body exercising any regulatory, taxing, importing or other governmental or quasi-governmental authority;

 

"Person" means a corporation, association, partnership (general or limited), joint venture, estate, trust, limited liability company, limited liability partnership or any other legal entity, individual or government, state or agency of a state;

 

"Personnel"has the meaning ascribed to it under Clause 5.1(c)of the Agreement;

 

"Project" as briefly described under recital (C) above and as detailed under Annexure I of the Agreement;

 

"Project Completion Date" has the meaning ascribed to it under Clause 4.3 of the Agreement;

 

"Tax" or "Taxation" means all forms of taxation, duties, levies, imposts and social security charges, including without limitation corporate income tax, withholding tax, value added tax, customs and excise duties, capital tax and other legal transaction taxes, real estate taxes, other municipal taxes and duties, environmental taxes and duties and any other type of taxes duties or cess in any relevant jurisdiction, together with any interest, penalties, surcharges or fines relating thereto, due, payable, levied, imposed upon or claimed to be owed in any relevant jurisdiction;

 

  1.         Interpretation

 

In this Agreement, unless the context otherwise provides.

  1.            Words using the singular or plural number also include the plural or singular number, respectively.

 

  1.            Any reference to any statute or statutory provision shall include all subordinate legislation made from time to time under that provision (whether or not amended, modified, re-enacted or consolidated) and such statute or provision as may be amended, modified, re-enacted or consolidated.

 

  1.             Any reference to an agreement, instrument or other document (including a reference to this Agreement) herein shall be to such agreement, instrument or other document as amended, supplemented or novated pursuant to the terms thereof.

 

  1.            The Schedule, Annexure and Exhibits to this Agreement form an integral part of this Agreement.

 

  1.               PURPOSE OF AGREEMENT

 

  1.         Subject to the proposal made by the Recipient and upon the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement, the Donor agrees to provide to the Recipient and the Recipient agrees to obtain from the Donor, the Grant, on the terms and conditions contained in this Agreement; and

 

  1.         Save as may be otherwise provided by the Donor in writing, the Recipient agrees and undertakes that the proceeds of the Grant shall be utilized exclusively for the purposes of undertaking Project and as per the terms set out in this Agreement.

 

  1.               CONDITION PRECEDENT

 

  1.         Notwithstanding any other provision under this Agreement, the Donor is not obligated to disburse any Grants and shall have the right to withdraw the Grants disbursed under this Agreement, if the Recipient:

 

  1.            has not made a proposal before the Donor in relation to undertaking the Project, in the manner required by the Donor;

 

  1.            is prohibited or excluded from receiving such Grants under Applicable Law for the time being in force in India; or

 

  1.             has been involved in or is alleged to be involved in activities which amount to contravention of any Applicable Law, including but not limited to the Foreign Contribution Regulation Act, 2010 ("FCRA").

 

  1.         The provisions of this Clause 3 shall be a continuing obligation of the Recipient which shall apply throughout the Term and any extension(s) thereof.

 

  1.               DISBURSEMENT OF GRANT

 

  1.         The Grant shall be disbursed in the format and in the manner stipulated by the Donor under Annexure II of the Agreement, subject to the compliance of the Recipient with the terms of this Agreement. Notwithstanding anything stated herein, the Donor may, in its sole discretion and determination, remit the Grant in any other manner that it may deem fit.

 

Subject to the Clause 4.1 above, the Grant shall be remitted, transferred and delivered into the Recipient's bank account with {{ngo_details.bank_name}} Bank, with its branch office located at {{ngo_details.branch_name}}, with IFSC Code {{ngo_details.ifsc_code}} within the time period specified in Annexure II or within any other time period determined by the Donor in terms of Clause 4.1

 

  1.  The Recipient represents and warrants that the Recipient's bank account specified under Clause 4.1 above is a non-FCRA account. The Recipient further agrees to issue a declaration to this effect seven (7) days before receipt of the Grant.

 

  1.         The Grant shall be exclusively used for undertaking the Project detailed under Annexure I within the project duration of {{proposal.grant_duration_in_months}} months i.e. from {{other_details.start_date}} – {{other_details.end_date}}  or within any other timeline as may be mutually agreed by the Parties ("Project Completion Date"). It is agreed between the Parties that the Project detailed under Annexure I may continue to apply, in the manner mutually agreed between the Parties in writing, and the Recipient may be provided additional grant amount as may be determined by Donor for Year II and Year III, if Parties mutually agree to extend the term of this Agreement. Notwithstanding the aforesaid term, the Parties agree that the grant amounts for Year II and Year III, as specified under Annexure II, are good faith estimates and non-binding, and Donor may modify the same in case of extension of the term of this Agreement. 

 

  1.               REPRESENTATION AND WARRANTIES AND INDEMNITY

 

  1.         The Recipient hereby represents and warrants that:

 

  1.            it will undertake the Project in a competent and workmanlike manner in accordance with the level of professional care customarily observed by highly skilled professionals rendering similar services;

 

  1.            the proposal, reports and/or other materials in connection with the Project provided by or on behalf of the Recipient shall not violate or infringe any third party's patents, trade secrets, trademarks, copyrights or other proprietary rights;

 

  1.             it has adequate personnel (whether employed directly or otherwise) ("Personnel") and resources with the necessary skills and qualifications to undertake the Project in a timely manner and that the Recipient as a prudent employer has sufficiently ascertained that the Personnel's credentials (including checking criminal track records, background investigation or references), are suitable to undertake the Project under this Agreement;

 

  1.            it and its Personnel are in compliance and will comply, at Recipient's sole cost, with all Applicable Law, including any order, judgment, notification, etc. issued by any Governmental Authority having jurisdiction over Recipient in connection with undertaking of the Project, and will hold, fully comply with and obtain or has already obtained (as applicable) all the required licenses, required registrations, permits and approvals as may be required from time to time under the Applicable Law;

 

  1.            it has all rights necessary for (and is not subject to any restriction, penalty, agreement, commitment, Applicable Law, rule, regulation, proceedings or order which is violated by) execution and delivery of this Agreement and performance of its obligations under this Agreement;

 

  1.              if the Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act 1970 ("CLRA") is applicable to the Recipient, then the Recipient shall make the requisite applications with the appropriate Governmental Authorities prior to using contract labour for undertaking the Services under this Agreement and intimate the Donor accordingly;

 

  1.            all Personnel are authorized to lawfully undertake the Project pursuant to applicable immigration and work status Applicable Law;

 

  1.            to the best of Recipient's knowledge after due inquiry, Recipient's Personnel have not been convicted of a felony in the previous 7 (Seven) years, or, if they have, the Recipient has (to the extent permitted under Applicable Law) provided information to the Donor regarding the nature, severity, and date of each such conviction; 

 

  1.              that the Personnel are its own employees and shall not be construed as employees of Donor at any time during the Agreement; and

 

  1.              in connection with this Agreement will comply with all applicable import, re-import, sanctions, anti-boycott, export, and re-export control laws, such as the Export Administration Regulations, the International Traffic in Arms Regulations, and economic sanctions programs implemented by the Office of Foreign Assets Control.

 

 

  1.         The Recipient hereby agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Donor, its Affiliates and Agents from and against any and all claims, losses or damages which may be asserted against or incurred by the Donor, as a result of or arising from, or in connection with or relating to: (a) breach, misrepresentation or inaccuracy of any of the representation and warranties made under this Agreement, including Clause 4.3 and 5.1 above; and (b) breach of, or failure to perform (whether in whole or part) any of the covenants, undertakings or obligations under this Agreement (subject to the Force Majeure Clause hereinafter below), by making payment to the Donor on demand in writing, of a sum equal to the aggregate of:

 

  1.            the amount which should be necessary to put the Donor into the financial position which would have existed had there been no breach of the representation or warranty or covenants or undertakings or obligations in question; and

 

  1.            all reasonable costs and expenses suffered or incurred by the Donor as a result of or in connection with such breach of representation or warranty or covenants or undertakings or obligations.

 

  1.         In addition to the above, Recipient agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless the Donor, from and against any and all claims, cost, penalty, interest, losses and damages which may be asserted against the Donor, as a result of, or arising from, or in connection with or relating to any default by the Recipient:: (a) arising from any act or omission by Recipient and/or its Personnel, including without limitation any breach or default under this Agreement, or allegation or claim of negligence, strict liability or misconduct; and(b) with regard to any matter relating to Tax, its payment, deduction, filings thereof and any Disputes in connection with the Taxation.

 

Recipient's duty to defend is independent of its duty to indemnify. Recipient's obligations under this Clause are independent of all of its other obligations under this Agreement. Recipient will use counsel reasonably satisfactory to the Donor to defend each claim, and Donor will cooperate (at Recipient's expense) with Recipient in the defense. Recipient will not consent to the entry of any judgment or enter into any settlement without Donor's prior written consent, which may not be unreasonably withheld.

In connection with any action to enforce Recipient's obligations under this Clause 5 with respect to any claim arising out of any bodily injury (including death) to any person directly or indirectly employed by the Recipient, Recipient waives any immunity, defense or protection under any workers' compensation, industrial insurance or similar laws and assumes liability for such claim. This paragraph will not be interpreted or construed as a waiver of the Recipient's right to assert any such immunity, defense or protection directly against any of its own employees or such employee's estate or other representatives.

 

  1.               ETHICS AND ANTI-CORRUPTION LAWS.

 

  1.         The Recipient agrees and undertakes to abide by Donor's Code of Business Conduct and Ethics available at http://phx.corporate-ir.net/phoenix.zhtml?c=97664&p=irol-govConduct(the "Code") which prohibits paying of bribes to anyone for any reason, whether in dealings with the government or the private sector or any statutory body. The Recipient shall not violate or knowingly permit anyone to violate the Code's prohibition on bribery or any applicable anti-corruption laws in performing under this Agreement. Donor shall have the right to immediately terminate or suspend performance under this Agreement or take such other action, as may be available under law, if the Recipient breaches this Clause. The Recipient shall maintain true, accurate and complete books and records concerning any payments made to another party by the Recipient under the Agreement, including on behalf of the Donor. Donor and its designated representative shall have the right to inspect the Recipient's books and records to verify such payments and for compliance with this Clause.

 

  1.         Recipient covenants and undertakes that it shall not make, authorize or tolerate to be made, in the performance of this Agreement, any payment, loans or gifts, or promises or offers of payments, loans, gift, of any money or anything of value, directly or indirectly, to or for the use or benefit of any employee of Donor or of its Agents, Affiliate or associate, etc.

 

 

  1.               CONFIDENTIALITY

 

  1.         The Parties agree that the terms and existence of this Agreement shall be kept confidential by each Party, except

 

  1.            where required by law or any Governmental Authority; or

 

  1.            to such Persons or entities for whom the Parties to this Agreement have approved in writing to disclose the terms and existence of this Agreement.

 

  1.         All information which any the Recipient may possess relating to the Donor as a result of negotiating or entering into this Agreement, the Recipient shall not, in any manner, use or disclose any such Confidential Information and at the request of the Donor, deliver promptly to the Donor or destroy, all tangible embodiments (and all copies) of such information in its possession.

 

 

  1.               AUDIT AND REPORTING

 

  1.         The Recipient shall provide the Donor with the audited Financial Statement, reports and other information relating to the utilization and expenditure of the Grant amount in the Project as specified in the Annexure III.

 

  1.         Notwithstanding the other provisions of this Agreement, and subject to prior written notice of 30 days, the Donor has the right to reasonably inspect the facilities, filing, books and records of the Recipient at reasonable working hours. .

 

  1.         The Recipient shall provide a periodic disclosure of program data to the donor. Such reports and data shall be submitted by the Recipient in a format and timeline mutually decided by the Parties as per Annexure IV, V, and VI.

 

 

  1.               TERM AND TERMINATION

 

  1.         This Agreement shall be effective from the Effective Date until the Project Completion Date unless the Parties mutually agree to renew the Agreement for a further period of one year subject to terms as specified under Clause 4.3 above. The Agreement may be terminated early by the Donor by providing a 45 (Forty Five) days written notice to the Recipient on the occurrence of any of the following events:

 

  1.            In the event of a breach by the Recipient of any of its conditions precedent, representations, warranties, covenants, undertakings or obligations specified herein and if such breach is not remedied within 45 (Forty Five) days; 

 

  1.            In case of non-compliance by the Recipient of the Donor's and its Affiliate's anti-bribery policy or Code; 

 

  1.             If the Recipient is involved in, charge-sheeted in or put under investigation in respect of contravention of the Applicable Law, including but not limited to FCRA; and/or

 

  1.            If the Recipient is dissolved, wound-up, surrenders its charter, makes an assignment in bankruptcy, makes a proposal to its creditors, or has a receiver appointed in respect of any of its assets.

 

  1.         Within 7 (Seven) days of the termination of this Agreement in terms of Clause 9.1 above, the Recipient shall return to the Donor, the un-utilized portion of Grant as available on the date of termination. Such return shall be effected in the manner and form prescribed by the Donor in this regard. The Recipient shall also provide the Donor with a certificate accompanied by such reports and documents, as may be requested by the Donor, evidencing the utilization of Grant up to the date of termination.

 

 

  1.           GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION

 

  1.     This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the Applicable Laws of India. The Parties irrevocably agree that, the courts at Bangalore, India shall have exclusive jurisdiction to settle any controversy, conflict or dispute of any nature between the Parties arising out of or relating to or in connection with any indemnity claim under this Agreement or any other provisions of this Agreement ("Dispute").

 

  1.     In case of any Dispute between the Parties, they shall for a period of 30 (thirty) days from the date of such Dispute, use all reasonable endeavours to resolve the matter amicably. If the Parties are unable to resolve the Dispute amicably, such a Dispute shall be settled before the courts of Bangalore.

 

  1.     Nothing contained hereinabove shall prejudice either Party's right to have recourse to any court having jurisdiction for the purpose of interim or interlocutory orders.

 

  1.           NOTICES

 

  1.     Any notice, document, or communication:

 

  1.            given by hand or by courier is deemed to be received at the commencement of the next Business Day following delivery to that addressee; and

 

  1.            sent by e-mail is deemed to be received at the commencement of the next Business Day following receipt by the sending Party of an electronic confirmation of transmission of the notice to that addressee or e-mail server.

 

  1.           MISCELLANEOUS

 

  1.     No Partnership

No Party shall act as an agent of any other Party or have any authority to act for or to bind any other Party, except as provided in this Agreement.

 

  1.     Entire Agreement

This Agreement shall contain the entire understanding of the Parties and shall supersede all prior agreements and understandings, both written and oral, among the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and shall be binding on each of the Parties.

 

  1.     Waiver

No amendment, modification or discharge of this Agreement shall be valid or binding unless set forth in writing and duly executed by the Parties hereto. No waiver shall be valid unless given in writing by the Party or Parties from whom such waiver is sought. Any such waiver shall constitute a waiver only with respect to the specific matter described in such writing and shall in no way impair the rights of the Party granting such waiver in any other respect or at any other time. Neither the waiver by any of the Parties of a breach of or a default under any of the provisions of this Agreement, nor the failure by any of the Parties, on one or more occasions, to enforce any of the provisions of this Agreement or to exercise any right or privilege hereunder, shall be construed as a waiver of any other breach or default of a similar nature, or as a waiver of any of such provisions, rights or privileges hereunder.

 

  1.     Independent Rights

Each of the rights of the Parties hereto under this Agreement are independent, cumulative and without prejudice to all other rights available to them, and the exercise or non-exercise of any such rights shall not prejudice or constitute a waiver of any other right of the Party, whether under this Agreement or otherwise.

 

  1.     Survival

If this Agreement is terminated in accordance with Clause 9.1 above, it shall become void and of no further force and effect, except for the Continuing Provisions, provided that termination shall, unless otherwise agreed by the Parties, be without prejudice to the accrued rights and obligations of the Parties at the date of such termination, including the rights of any Party in respect of a breach of this Agreement prior to such termination but shall not lead to any special, exemplary or consequential damages.

 

  1.     Specific Performance

The Parties agree that the Donor shall be entitled to an injunction, restraining order, right for recovery, suit for specific performance or such other equitable relief as a court of competent jurisdiction may deem necessary or appropriate to restrain the Recipient from committing any violation or enforce the performance of the covenants, representations and obligations contained in this Agreement. These injunctive remedies are cumulative and are in addition to any other rights and remedies that the Donor may have at law or in equity.

 

  1.     Non-Exclusive Remedies

The rights and remedies herein provided are cumulative and none is exclusive of any other, or of any rights or remedies that any Party may otherwise have at Applicable Law(s) or in equity. The rights and remedies of any Party based upon, arising out of or otherwise in respect of any inaccuracy or breach of any representation, warranty or agreement or failure to fulfil any condition shall in no way be limited by the fact that the act, omission, occurrence or other state of facts upon which any claim of any such inaccuracy or breach is based may also be the subject matter of any other representation, warranty, covenant or agreement as to which there is no inaccuracy or breach.

 

  1.     Severability

Each and every obligation under this Agreement shall be treated as a separate obligation and shall be severally enforceable as such and in the event of any obligation or obligations being or becoming unenforceable in whole or in part, such provision or provisions shall be deemed to be deleted from this Agreement and any such deletion shall not affect the enforceability of the remainder of this Agreement not so deleted, provided the fundamental terms of this Agreement are not altered.

 

  1.     Assignment

This Agreement shall not be capable of assignment by either Party without the prior written approval of the other Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Donor may in its sole discretion assign this Agreement (or any of its rights and obligations under this Agreement) without the Recipient's consent: (a) to any of its AffiliateFs; or (b) in connection with any merger, consolidation, reorganization, sale of all or substantially all of its assets or any similar transaction.

 

  1.  Counterparts

This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument and any Party may execute this Agreement by signing any one or more of such originals or counterparts.

 

  1.  No Strict Construction

The Parties have participated jointly in the negotiation and drafting of this Agreement. In the event of any ambiguity or question of intent or interpretation arises, this Agreement shall be construed as if drafted jointly by all Parties, and no presumption or burden of proof shall arise favouring or disfavouring any Party by virtue of the authorship of any provision of this Agreement.

 

  1.  Stamp Duty

Any stamp payable in India on this Agreement shall borne by the Recipient.

 

 

 

  1.  Third Party Rights

A Person who is not a Party to the Agreement or the successor or permitted assignee of either of the Parties shall have no right to enforce any of the terms of this Agreement. The Parties may amend or vary this Agreement in accordance with its terms without the consent of any other Person.

 

  1.  Further Assurance

The Recipient shall from time to time and at their own cost do, execute and deliver or procure to be done, executed and delivered all such further acts, documents and things required by, and in a form satisfactory to the Donor, in order to give full effect to this Agreement and its rights, powers and remedies under this Agreement.

 

  1.  Force Majeure

In no event shall the Recipient be responsible or liable for any failure/ delay in the performance or its obligations hereunder arising out of or caused by, directly or indirectly, forces beyond its control, including, without limitation, strikes, work stoppages, accidents, natural catastrophes or acts of God, Pandemic, acts of war or terrorism, civil or military disturbance and interruptions, loss or malfunctions of utilities, communications or computer services, the Recipient shall use reasonable efforts which are consistent with general acceptable practices such as installation of solar panels, to resume performance as soon as practicable under the circumstances. 

 

 

 

 

IN WITNESS WHEREOF each Party has executed this Agreement or caused this Agreement to be executed by its duly authorised representatives.
